title: California's Bishop Pines Are Dying. Is Drought To Blame?
teaser: Bishop pine only grows in a handful of places on the West Coast. In one of those places, the drought-stricken Channel Islands off the coast of California, they're dying off in huge numbers. Researchers are working to figure out why, and how they can save the pines.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
